Class DisplayableWindow

  • java.lang.Object
    • DisplayableWindow
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DisplayLevel, DisplayMandelbrot, DisplayMenu, DisplaySelect

    public abstract class DisplayableWindow
extends java.lang.Object
    abstract class DisplayableWindow Interface for the window data and layout for a window, to display each window.
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Stanley S. & Kaushik A.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DisplayableWindow() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract void display(long window)
      Abstract method to be implemented by subclasses to do the actual rendering of the window.
      abstract void doClick(int clickType, java.awt.Point location)
      When the user clicks a location on the window, this will be called.
      void doDrag(java.awt.Point location)
      When the user clicks and holds, then moves the mouse, this will be called.
      abstract void doRelease(int clickType, java.awt.Point location)
      When the user clicks, then lets go, this will be called.
      void doScroll(boolean directionIsUp, java.awt.Point location)
      When the user attempts to scroll, this will be called.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • DisplayableWindow

        public DisplayableWindow()

    • Method Detail

      • display

        public abstract void display(long window)
        Abstract method to be implemented by subclasses to do the actual rendering of the window.
        Parameters:
        window - The GLFWwindow pointer that holds the window's data. Needed to do any displaying.

      • doClick

        public abstract void doClick(int clickType,
                             java.awt.Point location)
        When the user clicks a location on the window, this will be called. Warning: This is asynchronous, and can happen at any time, EVEN WHEN OTHER METHODS ARE INPROGRESS.
        Parameters:
        clickType - Enumeration of which mouse button was used to do the click. See GLFW.GLFW_MOUSE_BUTTON_1 through GLFW.GLFW_MOUSE_BUTTON_8
        location - The point on the screen that was clicked.

      • doDrag

        public void doDrag(java.awt.Point location)
        When the user clicks and holds, then moves the mouse, this will be called. Warning: This is asynchronous, and can happen at any time, EVEN WHEN OTHER METHODS ARE INPROGRESS.
        Parameters:
        location - The point on the screen where the mouse was moved to.

      • doRelease

        public abstract void doRelease(int clickType,
                               java.awt.Point location)
        When the user clicks, then lets go, this will be called. Warning: This is asynchronous, and can happen at any time, EVEN WHEN OTHER METHODS ARE INPROGRESS.
        Parameters:
        clickType - Enumeration of which mouse button was used to do the click. See GLFW.GLFW_MOUSE_BUTTON_1 through GLFW.GLFW_MOUSE_BUTTON_8
        location - The point on the screen where the mouse is, upon being released.

      • doScroll

        public void doScroll(boolean directionIsUp,
                     java.awt.Point location)
        When the user attempts to scroll, this will be called. Warning: This is asynchronous, and can happen at any time, EVEN WHEN OTHER METHODS ARE INPROGRESS.
        Parameters:
        directionIsUp - This will be true, if the scroll is upward.
        location - The point on the screen where the mouse is, when it is scrolled.
